description.value:
Trigger A creature other than Darius or one of his homonculi approaches within 5 feet of the table or attempts to Interact with the crystals in any way other than to attempt to disable the hazard.

Effect The three large crystals on the table begin vibrating and humming. The hazard rolls initiative.

details.description: The three larger crystals on the table begin to vibrate and emit a swiftly growing peal of sound.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17] (trained) or @Check[type:occultism|dc:17] (trained) to disrupt the magic enchanting one of the crystals, or @Check[type:performance|dc:20] (trained) by a character who can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Counter Performance]{Counter Performance} to use sound to redirect the noise back into the crystal, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Dispel Magic]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level, DC 18) to counteract a crystal.
details.routine: (3 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for each crystal that's disabled or destroyed. On each of the trap's actions, one of the crystals fires a blast of sound at a single Small or larger creature in the room. The target is randomly determined and takes [[/r 1d8[sonic]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true]); a target who critically fails this save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Deafened]{Deafened} for 1 minute. At the end of the hazard's routine, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:10|name:Destroy a Crystal]. On a success, one of the crystals shatters and is destroyed.

source.value: Pathfinder Adventure: A Fistful of Flowers
